intro: Reseda muricata, commonly known as the rough Reseda, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in clusters and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Reseda muricata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in dye production.
